snippet.title: Best desktops
snippet.description: CNET's reviews of the best desktop computers include photos, video, and user reviews.

snippet.title: Windows 8
snippet.description: Navigate the ins-and-outs of Windows 8 with how-tos, troubleshooting, news, and reviews.

snippet.title: Nintendo 3DS XL
snippet.description: Three years in, the Nintendo 3DS handheld has become a seriously good game device -- especially for fans of Nintendo's classic gaming franchises -- and the XL is the one you should buy.

snippet.title: Borderlands 2 (PC)
snippet.description: Stellar writing and a host of small improvements help Borderlands 2 stand tall on the shoulders of its predecessor.

snippet.title: Orcs Must Die! 2 (PC)
snippet.description: Multiplayer co-op and a number of other great additions make diving into Orcs Must Die! 2 a delight.

snippet.title: Lenovo IdeaCentre B750
snippet.description: A refreshing new way to look at all-in-one desktops, the Lenovo B750's Blu-ray-friendly, extra-wide display is great for movies (if you add some extra software), and games greatly benefit from a wider field of view. It's different, and fun to use, but it cries out for a touch screen.

snippet.title: Guild Wars 2 (PC)
snippet.description: Guild Wars 2 is a paradise for explorers and thrill-seekers alike, and the best online role-playing game in years.

snippet.title: Symphony (PC)
snippet.description: Symphony is an exciting mouse-controlled shooter that delivers a dynamic way to enjoy your favorite music.

snippet.title: Unmechanical (PC)
snippet.description: Unmechanical is a pretty and pleasant puzzler, though it doesn't make a lasting impression.

snippet.title: Origin PC EON17-SLX
snippet.description: Cramming the most high-end parts into a massive 17-inch body will top $4,000, but you also get a powerful laptop that has more next-gen gaming muscle than any living-room console.
